section.title: When You Start &app;
section.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window. Contains titlebar, menubar, toolbar, library list (including smart library list) and an empty book display area. Menubar contains Library, Edit, View and Help menus.

section.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: The menus on the menubar contain all of the commands you need to work with libraries and books in &app;.
The toolbar contains buttons to quickly add new books and libraries to &app;, plus a search tool to filter books displayed in the main display area.

The library list pane at the left edge of the window displays the different libraries which have been set up in &app;. Below the main libraries, there is a list of smart libraries which are a kind of filtered view on the main libraries.
When &app; starts for the first time, it creates a library called My Library, and a set of useful smart libraries.

The main part of the display lists all the books in the current library. &app; can display your books either in an Icon or List view - the List View, similar to that used in the Nautilus file manager, displays detailed information about each book on separate lines.
In the icon view, your favourite books - rated with five stars - will be shown with a heart icon in the top corner.
The statusbar displays information about the current library in &app;, including the number of books, and the number of books which have not been rated.
